metadata.title: CVE-2020-36385 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.10.drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c has a use-after-free because the ctx isreached via the ctx_list in some ucma_migrate_id situations whereucma_close is called, aka CID-f5449e74802c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
